item.title: Tips for mapping individual parking spaces in #OpenStreetMap with #JOSM: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Lejun/diary/397549 Via #WeeklyOSM: https://weeklyosm.eu

#MapRoulette introduces Challenge Health Measures by archiving stale challenges and capping the number of tasks per challenge: https://blog.maproulette.org/2021/09/01/introducing-challenge-health-measures/. #OpenStreetMap
The #OpenStreetMap Belgium Mapper of the Month #MotM series visits Tanzania this month to let us meet Constantine Tumwine: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/09/01/constantine-tumwine.html
#OpenStreetMap Belgium’s Mapper of the Month #MotM goes all the way to Thailand to introduce Mishari Muqbil: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/08/01/mishari-muqbil.html
The “#OBS Studio Master Class” is a series of 40+ video tutorials to discover and master Open Broadcaster Software: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzo7l8HTJNK-IKzM_zDicTd2u20Ab2pAl.

If you’re searching how to improve the completeness of #OpenStreetMap mapping in your favorite area, StreetCompleteness shows completion percentage for chosen #StreetComplete quests: https://streetcompleteness.haukauntrie.de.
Create a #Lego #Map using #QGIS or #ArcGIS: https://www.gislounge.com/how-to-use-gis-to-make-a-lego-map/ #GIS #Tutorial

After a series of encounters around the globe, #OpenStreetMap Belgium’s Mapper of the Month #MotM is back home to interview Pieter, alias s8evq: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/07/01/s8evq.html.

Make a community presentation at an #OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF Board Meeting. Are you part of a local chapter, or a local community, putting together an organized project, or developing software? The board would love to hear from you. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mikelmaron/diary/397063

A 30-page “Assessment and Visualization of OSM Consistency for European Cities” (Athens, Berlin, Paris, Utrecht, Vienna, and Zurich): https://www.mdpi.com/2220-9964/10/6/361. The study evaluates the consistency based on the topological relationships between geographic features while considering semantics. One of the findings regarding POIs that must be inside buildings is an average position error was estimated at four meters. #OpenStreetMap #mdpi

State of the Map #SotM 2021 (July 9th – 11th, 2021) is the annual event for all mappers and #OpenStreetMap users and will be held online again. Free of charge. Only order a ticket if you are sure to participate. https://2021.stateofthemap.org

The “Street Art Cities Community” started in 2016 as a small attempt to create an online map to help out street art hunters hunt more effectively in their cities. It now features 33,424 artworks in 855 cities in 92 countries across the world. https://streetartcities.com/map #map #streetart #map #art Which artwork is your favorite one?

You can apply to maintain and develop #iD, the #OpenStreetMap editor. It’s a funded position with the OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF, with remuneration at market rates according to skills and commitments. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2021/06/15/apply-to-maintain-and-develop-id/ #jobs

Welcome To My Garden #wtmg are organizing their “Slow Travel Mini Festival” #slowtravel from 3 to 29 June with online conferences, like: - The 1001 ways of slow travelling - Collect data and improve maps while slow travelling: Introduction to #OpenStreetMap - Create your own itinerary: practical tips & tools - Opportunities of world's biggest encyclopedia for slow travellers: #Wikipedia Tickets are at a small fee to support the project. https://welcometomygarden.org/#mini-festival

Welcome To My Garden #wtmg is a not-for-profit network of citizens offering free #camping spots in their gardens to slow travellers: https://welcometomygarden.org. You can add your garden or explore the map.

#Lyft Mapping study shows crucial #OpenStreetMap road attributes are fresh and high quality in 30 North American cities, as compared to groundtruth: https://eng.lyft.com/how-lyft-discovered-openstreetmap-is-the-freshest-map-for-rideshare-a7a41bf92ec

#LG opens open-source licence compliance tool source: https://www.theregister.com/2021/06/04/lg_open_sources_fosslight/. Known as #FOSSlight, the suite helps users to ensure they are using code as permitted by its licence, looks out for known vulnerabilities in free and open-source software (#FOSS) so that developers address those holes, and can also check FOSS libraries and projects offered by third parties.
The #OpenStreetMap Mapper of the month #MotM stops in Ivory Coast this month to let us get to know Racky: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/06/01/racky.html
A short video update on the progress of #Microcosms in #OpenStreetMap at Mapping USA: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n85L6LttgjU&list=PLqjPa29lMiE0NZ-ouVFWgwz8vftq7dAd1&index=10
An 8 min. video about “What is new on #OSMCha?” A Mapping USA (Spring 2021) presentation by Wille Marcel. #OpenStreetMap https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VO1dnOEKgKM
